intro: Farsetia elongata, commonly known as the elongated farsetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Farsetia elongata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to adapt to semi-arid conditions.
